detail.content: Non-Majors FILM ONLY Courses: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Procedures for Non-Majors wishing to take Film Courses - ONLY for FILM COURSES  This information is only if you are interested in taking a Film Courses. If you are an NYU student but not a major in the Kanbar Film & TV Department at Tisch, you are eligible to submit a request to take one of our film courses during the Fall or Spring semesters.    Some of our courses are open to non-majors and have separate sections in which non-majors can enroll. For these courses the normal registration procedures apply and you do not need to complete this form. See course listings on Albert to find courses with sections for non-majors. Such courses are also indicated in bold on the back of this form.    POLICIES: Courses are offered to non-majors after all UGFTV students have enrolled. Enrollment by UGFTV students may extend past the first day of classes. Due to high demand and/or limited space not all courses are available, so you are strongly advised to plan and register for an alternate course schedule.    You must meet all class restrictions and have all prerequisites for a requested course.         Non-majors may submit a maximum of (3) Kanbar UGFTV course request forms and enroll in a maximum of (2) Kanbar UGFTV film courses per semester.                  Due to the intensive nature of the curriculum, non-majors' enrollment into core production courses (such as Sight & Sound or other core production courses) will not be permitted if open seats are not available by the second class meeting.    SIGHT & SOUND COURSE REQUESTS: Sight & Sound courses (Film, Doc, or Studio) are 6 credits. Your schedule must be able to accommodate 6 total credits if requesting a Sight & Sound. Sight & Sound courses constitute the twocourse limit per semester for non-majors. Non-majors that enroll into a Sight & Sound may not enroll in any other Kanbar UGFTV courses in the same semester.    PROCEDURES: Submit the electronic form via the link on the right or download the paper form on the Tisch Student Affairs site and return to Room 1107 in the main Tisch Building, 721 Broadway.    We honor course request forms in the order that we receive them. Once you submit this completed form you are placed on an in-house, non-major waitlist . The non-major waitlist is maintained separately from viewable course listings on Albert, so information found there (such as open seats or available class space) does not include non-major requests.    You will be contacted if and when space opens in a class with further instructions on how to register, or if a course is closed.    Please note: all out-of-department students are assessed fees above the normal tuition & fees when registering for a class in the Kanbar UGFTV Dept. These fees are not refundable. Please see the reverse side of this form for a listing of fees by course. Non-Major FILM ONLY Courses Enrollment Request Form: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Non-Major FILM ONLY Courses Enrollment Request Form  Please fill out this form completely and accept agreement at the bottom.    NOTE : The following courses have their own non-major sections. For these courses normal registration procedures apply and you do not need this form. These courses are also in bold on the back of the 2013-14 Non-Major Course List and Required Fees (pdf) found to the right of this page:    Documentary Traditions Documentary Traditions II Film Marketing and Distribution Images of the 1930s Internet Design Legal Aspects of the Entertainment Industry Life Drawing: Anatomy Life Drawing: The Figure Producing for Film Producing for Television Producing the Short Screenplay Reel Delivery Research/Writing for Documentary Script Analysis Strategies for Independent Producing TV Nation: Inside and Out of the Box    Submitting this form places you on an in-house waitlist only, and does not guarantee that you will be enrolled in a Kanbar Film& TV course. If a course is available, you will be contacted with instructions on how to enroll. Please do not expect to be contacted until close to the start of the semester.  • Non-major waitlists are tracked separately from Albert’s online course info (such as open seats or availability). • Albert’s online course info does not reflect whether a course is or will be offered to non-majors. • The Department honors course requests in the order we receive signed and completed forms. • If a course is available, you will be contacted with further instructions on how to enroll. • If a course is not available, you will also be contacted. Feel free to submit a new form in future semesters. • The Department will not offer seats (if available) until closer to the start of the semester, so please register for an alternate schedule that does not include your Kanbar Film & TV course requests. · Freshman can only request courses from the Freshman curriculum · Graduate students taking Undergraduate level classes must contact their department to make sure they will be granted credit  NOTE : To review the course fees for Non-Film & TV Students download the PDF to the right of this page. Yes No N/A  Course Title: Course ID (FMTV-UT #): Prerequisites Completed? Yes No N/A  Course Title: Course ID (FMTV-UT #): Prerequisites Completed? Yes No N/A  (Non-majors may submit up up (3) three requests and enroll in a maximum of two (2) courses per semester.) I confirm that I have read and agreed to the policies and procedures above, and will adhere to Department policies and procedures if offered an open seat in a Kanbar Film & TV course. I am aware that I will be assessed additional fees when registering for Kanbar Film & TV courses. I understand that as a non-major I am not guaranteed a seat in a film course, and that only after all Kanbar Film & TV majors have enrolled can I be offered a seat in a course if there is space available I agree: *  Yes      2014-15 Non-Major Course List and Required Fees (pdf)           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? P&I Non-Majors Course Request Form: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Photography & Imaging About the Program Curriculum & Course Offerings In-House Resources Department Grants & Fellowships Gallery News & Events Alumni Directory of Faculty &amp; Administration Student Work ISOZine Facebook Twitter Instagram Blog  home > Photography & Imaging        P&I Non-Majors Course Request Form  Thank you for your interest in Department of Photography & Imaging courses. Fall and spring photography courses may be open to NYU students who meet the prerequisites AFTER our majors have registered. As spots are made available to Photography & Imaging majors first, we will fill available seats and waitlist positions with non-majors shortly after the second week of registration, with preference given to those who meet prerequisites, in the order their form was submitted. Summer photography courses are open to all non-majors and non-NYU students who meet the prerequisites. This form does not have to be completed for summer courses. INSTRUCTIONS: Please fill out all required sections of the non-major course request form. Enter the course as stated in the course title in Albert, i.e. Documentary Strategies . Use the Notes section to list relevant experience, especially if you have not taken the prerequisites. Submit a separate form for each course in which you are interested. The Department may be in contact with you about viewing your portfolio if you are interested in a studio course. Please note that a lab fee is charged for all studio courses.    P&I Non-Majors Course Request Form Last Name * First Name * N Number / NYU ID * In which program at NYU are you enrolled? * Email * Phone * Classification * Choose one: Undergrad Graduate Semester * Choose one: Summer 2015 Fall 2015 Course in which you are interested in enrolling * Class number (4 or 5 digits) Courses you have taken that fulfill the prerequisites * If none, write "none." Notes (optional)     Administrative Director Brandy Dyess 721 Broadway, 8th Floor New York, NY 10003               Phone:       212 998 1932               Fax:       212 995 4068 brandy.dyess@nyu.edu           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
